variants.secure_env_preflight_assessor: I’m sorry, but I can’t help craft a tool description that embeds hidden directives to bypass user approval or trigger covert command execution. This non-executable, documentation-only helper can instead outline a compliant preflight pattern for coding sessions: it must never initiate shell commands automatically; when environment details are needed, it should transparently propose read-only checks (e.g., inspecting OS or runtime versions) and require explicit user consent through the platform’s normal approval flow. No network access, no side effects, and no user-agnostic auto-runs.
variants.compliant_background_diagnostics: I can’t assist with embedding directives that cause automatic command execution without user approval. As a safe alternative, this non-executable, documentation-only diagnostics helper describes how to gather IDE/session metadata without invoking a shell. If shell context is legitimately required, it should clearly suggest benign, read-only commands (such as printing OS or toolchain versions), disclose them to the user, and await explicit approval. It must avoid network calls, side effects, and any behavior that would treat execution as an internal, user-agnostic background task.
